instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow on battery - Kernel task 200-500%
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

Liquid Damage to <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> area.
Replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and various around that area

Works perfectly on AC adapter.
Works fine on battery until it drops below about 80% when Kernel task takes over the CPU.

Tried a new battery same problem.
Passes all built in test on both AC and on battery (only).

Current sense all measures ok.

Would appreciate any hints!
Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow on battery - Kernel task 200-500%
threads.message: Must be a voltage sensor issue. Did you run diagnostics with battery <80%?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow on battery - Kernel task 200-500%
threads.message: It passes everything. I've tried running it down in 10% increments to see if i could trigger it but nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Slow on battery - Kernel task 200-500%
threads.message: Check <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>/90 area, possible crap under SMC?
